page.title: 12Haslington - Housing.
page.content: The majority of houses of the area are of the Victorian period although new building is being carried out.There are many farms and adjoining farm workers cottages.The largest settlement is the village of Haslington .The Hawk Inn and the two black and white cottages opposite are dated 1510 and these are the oldest buildings in the area. Much development has taken place west of the main road and property dates from 1930 to 1980's. Very little property is rented, the majority being owner occupied.The new development is high density,open plan property,much of which is semi-detached.
